column2: You will get UTR units from vanilla Black ICE event or UTR event OOB's

We need more special trained and equipped units to fight in africa.

Options
You can have bulk of four "Afrika-Divisions" with one korps or without it.
Divisions have Afrika brigade, armored cars, staff and truck transports

Should we start training these units?

The 352nd was formed in November 1943 in France, commanded by Generalleutnant Dietrich Kraiss from 6 November 1943 until it was destroyed in July 1944. Organizationally, the 352nd was better off than most German divisions in 1944 although other divisions too were very powerful. At that time, as a result of severe personnel losses, German infantry divisions were generally reduced to six battalions. The 352nd, however, retained its full complement of nine battalions.

The soldiers of the 916th and 726th regiments occupied slit trenches, eight concrete bunkers, 35 pillboxes, six mortar pits, sites for 35 Nebelwerfers, (multi-barrel rocket launchers) and 85 machine-gun nests. The defenses were clustered in strongpoints.
The 916th Grenadier Regiment saw action during D-Day (Operation Overlord), opposing the US 1st and 29th divisions at Omaha Beach. The 352nd gave a good account of itself, causing many casualties and defending the bluffs above the beach for several hours before being overwhelmed.
The 916th retreated in the morning hours of 7 June after the commander, Colonel Ernst Goth, could no longer hold the positions retaken in the night of 6/7 June.

Soldier named Heinrich Severloh inflicted a large number of casualties on the US forces landing on Omaha Beach from a machine gun emplacement known as “Widerstandsnest 62” and was nicknamed the "Beast of Omaha Beach".

The 22. Panzer-Division was formed in September 1941 in France. It was transferred to the southern sector of the Eastern front in February 1942. It was encircled and almost destroyed during the fighting near Stalingrad.\n\nThe division is upgraded in 1st November 1942.

On November 19, 1942, Operation Uranus began. The great Soviet counter-offensive encircled the German 6th Army and much of the 4th Panzer Army and smashed the XXXXVIII Panzer Corps, including the 22nd Panzer Division. Many of the division's tanks had been parked in dugouts for an extended period of time and protected from the frost by straw. When the tanks were called on to respond to the Soviet offensive, many could not be started because mice had sought refuge in the straw and then in the tanks where they chewed up the insulation of electric system wires. The ability of the division to put up effective resistance was also compromised by the prior piecemeal deployment of division assets to shore up the Romanian line.

The 23. Panzer-Division was formed in September 1941 in France from Panzer-Brigade 101 and replacement troops. It was transferred to the southern sector of the Eastern front in April 1942 and took part in the failed attempt to relieve the surrounded troops at Stalingrad. It withdrew through the Ukraine and Poland until October 1944 when it was sent to Hungary. It fought in Hungary and Slovakia before being destroyed by the Red Army in Austria.

The 25. Panzer-Division was formed in February 1942 in Eberswalde and was sent to Norway where it remained until August 1943 when it was transferred to Denmark where it took part in the disarming of the Danish Army. It was sent to the Eastern front in October and suffered heavy losses during the withdrawal through the Ukraine. It was once again sent to Denmark, this time for refitting in May 1944. It was sent to the front in Poland in September 1944 and withdrew through Poland and into eastern Germany where it ended the war.

The 26. Panzer-Division was formed in September 1942 in Belgium from parts of 23. Infanterie-Division. It was transferred to Amiens, France in October 1942 for training and coastal defense and remained there until July 1943 when it was sent to Italy where it fought the Allied landings. It surrendered to the Allies in northern Italy at the end of the war.

The 27. Panzer-Division was formed in October 1942 in southern Russia from Kampfgruppe Michalik (formed from elemets of 22. Panzer-Division). It fought at Voronezh and Voroshilovgrad until it was disbanded on 15 February 1943 and absorbed into 7. Panzer-Division and 24. Panzer-Division.

You can choose the historic with one panzer battalion and infantry regiment
Or go with the one Pz.-regiment and two infantry regiments.
The 97. Leichte Infanterie-Division was formed on 10 December 1940 near Bad Tölz. It was redesignated 97. Jäger-Division on 6 July 1942.

The 97. Jäger-Division was formed on 6 July 1942. It can trace its origins to the 97th Light Infantry Division which was formed in December 1940. It fought in the Kursk offensive and suffered heavy losses. It was transferred to the lower Dnieper and fought well during the retreat through the Ukraine. The division was transferred to Slovakia in October 1944 and surrendered to the Red Army near Deutsch Brod in May 1945. it was one of the most highly decorated units of in the German army.

The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 501 was formed on 10 May 1942 in Erfurt, commanded by Major Hans-Georg Lueder.

It was sended to North Africa following the Allied landings in Africa. The first tanks arrived in Tunisia November 1942. It surrendered in Tunisia May 1943.

It was reformed in September 1943 from the cadre that had not been sent to Africa and was sent to the Eastern front in November and fought at Vitebsk and Gorodok.

It will be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger) tanks in July 1944

Do you want to form it?
The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 501 was refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger) tanks in July 1944 and attached to Heeresgruppe Nordukraine.

The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 502 was formed in 25 May 1942 at Bamberg from the 35th Panzer Training Battalion. First tanks arrived at the front near Leningrad on 29 August 1942. On 22 September, after crossing a causeway, a Tiger became bogged down in the mud, due to enemy fire the tank could not be recovered despite a number of attempts. the tank was destroyed on 25 November to prevent its capture by the enemy. This marked the first total loss of a Tiger I.

Historicly it only received a few Tiger IIs. But it can be refitted in April 1945

Do you want to form it?
The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 502 can be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger).

The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 503 was originally planned for North Africa but was sent to the Eastern front. It fought in southern Russia, taking part in the Don campaign and the withdrawal from Stalingrad.

it will be re-equipped with the new Tiger II in july 1944.

Do you want to form it?
The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 503 can be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger).

The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 504 was formed in February 1943 Fallingbostel, and one company was sent to North Africa in Marvh 1943. It surrendered in Tunisia in May 1943. The second company was attached to Fallschirm-Panzer-Division Hermann Göring and fought the Allies after the landing on Sicily in July 1943. It was evacuated across Messina Strait to Italy and was sent to Holland for refitting. The 504 returned to Italy in June 1944 and was attached to SS Panzergrenadier Division Götz von Berlichingen. It fought the Allies at Anzio in support of 362. Infanterie-Division.

It will be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger) tanks in December 1944.

Do you want to form it?
The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 504 can be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger).

The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 505 was formed in January 1943. It was assigned to 9. Armee and fought at Kursk and after Kursk it was attached to Heeresgruppe Mitte and fought at Smolensk.

It was refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger) tanks in September 1944 and fought with 24. Panzer-Division and 5. Panzer-Division in East Prussia until the end of the war.

Do you want to form it?
The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 505 can be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger).

The Schwere Panzer Abteilung 506 was formed in July 1943 around a cadre from 9. Panzer-Division. It fought with Heeresgruppe Mitte at the Dnieper and later at Krivoi-Rog.

It was sent to Germany and refitted with Tiger II (Köningstiger) tanks in August 1944. It fought the Allies near Arnhem (during Operation Market Garden) and at Aachen.

It took part in the Ardennes offensive (as the only Tiger tank battalion from the Heer) in December 1944.

Do you want to form it?
The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 506 can be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger).

The Schwere Panzer Abteilung 507 was formed in September 1943 around a cadre from 13. Panzer-Division. It arrived at the front in March 1944 and fought the red army at Vitebk and Narev.

It was refitted with Tiger II (Köningstiger) tanks in February 1945 and surrendered to the Red Army at the end of the war after a failed attempt to reach the American troops.

Do you want to form it?
The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 507 can be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger).

The Schwere Panzer Abteilung 508 was formed in August 1943 and was sent to Italy. It fought the Allies at Anzio and through Italy suffering heavy casualties. It was disbanded in February 1945 and transferred to Germany for training with Tiger II, this did not happen and they fought as infantry at the end of the war.

It can be refitted with Tiger II (Köningstiger) tanks in February 1945.

Do you want to form it?
The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 508 can be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger).

The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 509 was formed in September 1943 around a cadre from 22. Panzer-Division. It fought on the Eastern front, seeing action at Kirovograd, Kiev and Pavlova. It was attached to SS Panzer Division Das Reich in November 1943.

It can be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger) tanks in December 1944.

Do you want to form it?
The Schwere Panzer-Abteilung 509 can be refitted with Tiger II (Königstiger).

The Schwere Panzer Abteilung 510 was formed in June 1944 at Paderborn and it July it was sent to Lithuania where it fought in the Kurland pocket until the end of the war attached to 14. Panzer-Division.\n\nDo you want to form it?

Division insignias are my design and are based on their name. You will get events to form the divisions with some background for reasons why unit logo is what it is.\n\nDo you want to form the SS-Paperdivisions?

Do you want to form the Paperdivision:
SS-Grenadier-Division 'Kalevala (Finnische nr.1)'?

Division is formed from the veterans of SS-Freiwilligen-Battalion 'Nordost', and other finnish volunteers. 2000 men are shipped to danzig where the division will start to reinforce and rearm. Division is build around three regiments:

101. SS-Grenadier-Regiment
102. SS-Grenadier-Regiment
103. SS-Grenadier-Regiment

Reich needs your help to build rest of the division.

Paper Division: 39. SS Gebirgs Division 'Andreas Höfer'

Andreas Hofer (November 22, 1767 – February 20, 1810) was a Tyrolean innkeeper and drover, who in 1809 became the leader of the Tyrolean Rebellion against the French and Bavarian occupation forces during the War of the Fifth Coalition. He was subsequently captured and executed. Hofer is still today venerated as a folk hero, freedom fighter and Austrian patriot.

Insignia has the eagle of the Tyrol coat of arms.

Paper Division: 40. SS Freiwillige Panzergrenadier Division 'Feldherrnhalle'

It means a "Field Marshall's Hall".

Insignia has the same marking as the wehrmacht division.

Paper Division: 42. SS Grenadier Division 'Niedersachsen'

Name means "Lower Saxony" and it's capital is Hannover.

Insignia comes from it capital coat of arms.

Paper Division: 43. SS Grenadier Division 'Reichsmarschall'

Named after Hermann Göring or atleast after his tittle.

Insignias has the Reichsmarschalls scepter.

Paper Division: 44. SS Panzer Grenadier Division 'Wallenstein'

Albrecht Wenzel Eusebius von Wallenstein was a military leader and politician, who offered his services, and an army of 30,000 to 100,000 men during the Thirty Years' War (1618–48), to the Holy Roman Emperor Ferdinand II. He became the supreme commander of the armies of the Habsburg Monarchy and a major figure of the Thirty Years' War.

Insignia has the lion from the coat of arms from his home town Hermanice east of Praha.

Paper Division: 45. SS Grenadier Division 'Waräger'

The Varangians or Varyags was the name given by Greeks and East Slavs to Vikings, who between the 9th and 11th centuries ruled the medieval state of Rus' and formed the Byzantine Varangian Guard.

Insignia has a classic two crossing axes.
The 100. Leichte Infanterie-Division was formed in December 1940 and was redesignated 100. Jäger-Division in July 1942.

The 100. Jäger-Division was formed when 100. Leichte Infanterie-Division was redesignated in July 1942 and fought in the encirclement and Battle of Staryyogkol, the advance across the Don, the drive to the Volga and the street fighting in Stalingrad. It was encircled with 6. Armee in November 1942 and destroyed in January 1943.\n\nIt was reformed in the Belgrade area in April 1943 and was transferred to Albania in July. It was transferred to the eastern front in March 1944 and joined the forces fighting to break the encirclement of 1. Panzer-Armee. It took part in the withdrawal from Russia and the fighting in Hungary before surrendering to the Soviet Red Army at the end of the war in Silesia.
The 101. Leichte Infanterie-Division was formed on 10 December 1940. It was redesignated 101. Jäger-Division on 6 July 1942.

The 101. Jäger-Division was formed when 101. Leichte Infanterie-Division was redesignated in July 1942 and fought in the battle of Kharkov, The Caucasus campaign and the retreat into the Kuban. It suffered heavy losses during the fighting from both the Red army and the partisans. It was evacuated across the Kerch straits and transferred to lower Dneper late 1943.\n\nIt was surrounded with the 1. Panzer-Armee in March 1944 and formed the rear guard of XXXXVI Panzerkorps in the breakout. It participated in retreats across the Ukraine and was transferred to Slovakia in October 1944. It retreated through Hungary and Austria during 1945 and was at battle group strength when it surrendered to the US forces at the end of the war.
The 104. Jäger-Division was formed on 1 April 1943 by the reorganization and redesignation of the 704. Infanterie-Division. It surrendered to the Yugoslav Army at Celje, Slovenia in May 1945.
Do you want to form: Jäger-Divisions\n\nDivisions will form in Berlin with jäger regiments ready.

The 6. Gebirgs-Division was formed in 1940 and served as an occupation force in France before being transferred to Poland. It then took part in the invasion of Greece and remained there until September 1941 when it was transferred to Norway. It took part in the invasion of the Soviet Union and the offensive towards Murmansk, it remained there until late 1944 when it retreated to Norway following the Finnish withdrawal from the war.

The 99. Leichte Infanterie-Division was formed in November 1940 at Bad Kissingen. It fought on the southern sector of the Eastern Front until being withdrawn to Germany and reorganized into 7. Gebirgs-Divison in October 1941.

The 7. Gebirgs-Division was formed through the redesignation of 99. Leichte Infanterie-Division in the fall of 1941. It was sent to the front in Finland early 1942 and remained there until the Finnish withdrawal from the war when in retreated to Norway where it remained until the end of the war.
Do you want to form the Gebirgs-Division HQ's?

German Division Nr. 188 was raised in late 1939. It consisted of the 136th, 138th and 139th Mountain Replacement Regiments and the 112th Artillery Replacement Regiment, plus supporting units. It began the war on border guard duty in the mountainous region between Austria and Yugoslavia with the primary mission of training reservists and replacements for the regular mountain divisions. In the spring of 1941 it joined the invasion of Yugoslavia, with the three mountain regiments given responsibility of seizing control of Carniola and Carinthia on the Yugoslav side of the border, which they carried out quickly and effectively against little to no resistance.

Forming this unit will have boost in training reservists and replacements for the regular mountain divisions. But with large cost of supplies for training purposes.

Also HQ with two regiments for 8. Gebirgs-Division is formed.
Fires Other Gebirgs event if GGA mod is not used.

War is inevitable. We need forces capable of doing naval invasions. Should we form the divisional staff's for:

1. Marine-Infanterie-Division
2. Marine-Infanterie-Division
3. Marine-Infanterie-Division
8. Marine-Infanterie-Division
11. Marine-Infanterie-Division
16. Marine-Infanterie-Division

Historicly German naval divisions where formed in 1945. From the Kriegsmarine personnel no longer required to crew ships or for shore establishments.

If you buy your naval/marine infantry from other nations like Japan, you should select the Reserve option.

Forming them in 1945 will have high cost for our naval organization!
(You can refuse taking them now and then.)
Do you want to form the marine divisions from the Kriegsmarine personnel no longer required to crew ships or for shore establishments?\n\nThis will have high cost for our naval organization.
Do you want to mobilize the 3th wave HQ's?
Do you want to mobilize the 4th wave HQ's?
Do you want to mobilize the 5th wave HQ's?
Do you want to mobilize the 6th wave HQ's?

Fallschirmjägers played an important role during World War II. German Fallschirmjäger in World War II were the first paratroopers to be committed in large-scale airborne operations. They came to be known as the "green devils" by the Allied forces they fought against, as well as for their uniquely distinct morale.

The Luftwaffe built up a division-sized unit of three Fallschirmjäger regiments plus supporting arms and air assets, known as the 7th Flieger Division.

Should we start training more of these "green devils", as they could come very usefull.

This will start the event chain of the Fallschirmjäger-Divisions.

You can have the historic Fj.-Divisions earlier.
If you are willing to invest more resources to train and equip them.

Fallschirmjäger training centers.

You will get corps with few brigade units what represents certant division training center.

System works that disbanding this unit will launch event that gives you a division.

How good division is given, depends the year you disband the corps.
Letting them to be trained longer also gives you more tech bonuses.

-You can move it where you like it to be.
-Renaming brigade is deleting.
-Let them upgrade and be prioritized, as this represents the cost of training.

After disbanding it usually takes some time after the event is launched. It is wise to disband the unit early of the year
We are ready to expand the number of our Fallschirmjäger training centers.
